channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpath is completely blocked by crops, 5th July
item.description:
USRN 40102491 - The footpath across this field is not usable due to crops, it is also not possible to walk around the field. The adjacent public footpath sign is also missing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leigh, Tewkesbury

item.title: Flyposter for cafe on railings, 5th July
item.description:
This flyposter is attached to the railings by the entrance to the nature reserve. It is one of many of exactly the same flyposters dotted around Leckhampton, including the one attached to the telegraph pole on the corner of Westbury Rd and Old Bath Road. Multiple posters have had to be removed from that spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 200, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Cherry Orchard, Tewkesbury

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Wire fencing between parkland and grounds of Swindon Hall falling down, 5th July
item.description:
Fencing has been listing over for months, not sure who is responsible for it but it could be used by vehicles to access the park if it falls right over, The village has had problems in the past with unauthorised travellers setting up camp on the park by entering via the private road alongside which leads to houses beyond Swindon Hall itself, near to the pond so preventative action would be helpful
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on old Pates' field, 5th July
item.description:
By the fence towards the top left of the field. Please can it be tidied up before it injures a child or animal. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are 2 jutting covers (BT?) on Hales Rd at the junctions with Strickland Rd & Upper Park St that are a trip hazard. A resident recently tripped over on one of them and badly grazed their arm. Next time it could have be worse i.e. break or fracture. There is also a dip in the pavement close to the manhole cover at the Hales Rd/Strickland junction which is also a trip hazard., 5th July
item.description:
Pavement on Hales Rd at the junction with Strickland Road and the junction with Upper Park St. Two covers (possibly BT?)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Capel lane London road, 5th July
item.description:
This is a public foot path as well as high way. We have so far had to have two vehicles alined due to going over uneven road and pot holes costing so far Â£700 The road has had many patch ups over the past few years however pot holes are still appearing. They are also a trip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Capel Lane, Cheltenham
